Custom view `ScrimView` overrides `onTouchEvent` but not `performClick`
`onTouch` lambda should call `View#performClick` when a click is detected
Custom view `ToolbarControlContainer` overrides `onTouchEvent` but not `performClick`
Custom view `ToolbarPhone` overrides `onTouchEvent` but not `performClick`
Custom view `TouchRestrictingFrameLayout` overrides `onTouchEvent` but not `performClick`

Manually populating or sending TYPE_WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED events should be avoided. They may be ignored on certain versions of Android. Prefer setting UI metadata using `View.onInitializeAccessibilityNodeInfo`, `Activity.setTitle`, `ViewCompat.setAccessibilityPaneTitle`, etc. to inform users of crucial changes to the UI.
